value.title: This ‘AI doctor’ can assess skin melanoma as accurately as human dermatologists
value.excerpt: Scientists from the University of Gothenburg have developed an algorithm that identifies the severity of skin melanoma as accurately as dermatologists.

value.title: Pediatric brain tumors can be classified using diffusion weighted imaging and machine learning
value.excerpt: Diffusion weighted imaging and machine learning can successfully classify the diagnosis and characteristics of common types of pediatric brain tumors a UK-based multi-center study, including WMG at the University of Warwick has found.

value.title: How AI could spot your weaknesses and influence your choices
value.excerpt: In experiments, an AI system successfully learned to influence human decisions. That could be useful in behavioral sciences, public policy, and welfare.

value.title: Is AI just a fairy tale? Not in these successful use cases

value.title: A machine learning approach to identify drugs that could be repurposed to fight COVID-19
value.excerpt: When the Covid-19 pandemic struck in early 2020, doctors and researchers rushed to find effective treatments. There was little time to spare.

value.title: Nissan says 'not in talks with Apple' over autonomous car project
value.excerpt: Nissan Motor Co Ltd said on Monday it is not in talks with Apple Inc, following a report that the iPhone maker approached the Japanese company in recent months about a tie-up for its autonomous car project.

value.title: COVID-19 has made Americans lonelier than ever, but AI can help

value.title: Salesforce: Combining AI and automation can give us superpowers and make us more productive
value.excerpt: Salesforce Einstein Automate is just the beginning. John Kucera, SVP of Product Management for Automation at Salesforce, believes the combination of AI and automation into voice-enabled digital assistants will give us "superpowers" that help people build relationships and make us more productive.

value.title: Will Artificial Intelligence Produce Synthetic Sociopaths?
value.excerpt: Some day soon, computers may convincingly mimic human empathy. Will this lead to ethical artificial intelligence, or synthetic sociopathy?

value.title: Forethought's CEO Deon Nicholas On Growing An Enterprise Software Startup
value.excerpt: Taking on the challenge of creating customer service chatbots that learn and continually improve the quality of responses instead of providing rote, canned remarks is ideal for AI and machine learning.

value.title: How Hardware, Data And Artificial Intelligence Are Changing Diabetes Care
value.excerpt: According to Søren Smed Østergaard, Vice President, Digital Health of Novo Nordisk, the most significant innovations in the diabetes space centered around hardware, artificial intelligence (AI) and data.

value.title: Russian police use facial recognition or ‘face control’ against protesters
value.excerpt: He was detained on his way there by police using facial recognition technology in the Moscow metro. But reports from other protesters who have attend rallies in recent weeks in support of jailed opposition politician Alexei Navalny also indicate police are using facial recognition technology to make preventive arrests and detentions.

value.title: How a Chinese scientist in the US is helping defend AI systems from cyberattacks
value.excerpt: Li Bo, an award-winning scientist, helps major tech firms like IBM and various financial institutions defend themselves against cyber threats.

value.title: AI progress depends on us using less data, not more
value.excerpt: Compute costs, spurious noise, and privacy problems all mean that we can't keep moving toward bigger and bigger datasets to fuel AI progress.

value.title: How Can We Fix the Data Science Talent Shortage?
value.excerpt: Data science might just be the most buzzed-about job in tech right now, but its pop culture sheen conceals some of the harsh realities of being a fresh graduate in the industry. The job topped LinkedIn’s yearly Emerging Jobs Report from 2016 to 2019 consecutively (it is now at #3).

value.title: AI Emerges as Crucial Tool for Groups Seeking Justice for Syria War Crimes
value.excerpt: Rights groups are using machine learning to sort through a mammoth trove of video, photo and other evidence to build Syrian war-crimes cases.

value.title: Thought-detection: AI has infiltrated our last bastion of privacy
value.excerpt: Research from the UK and an update from Elon Musk on human trials at his brain interface company show software is now eating the mind.

value.title: A New Artificial Intelligence Makes Mistakes—on Purpose
value.excerpt: But one artificial intelligence program is taking a few steps backward, to appreciate how average humans play—blunders and all. The AI chess program, known as Maia, uses the kind of cutting-edge AI behind the best superhuman chess-playing programs.

value.title: Forget Self-Driving Cars—the Pentagon Wants Autonomous Ships, Choppers and Jets
value.excerpt: The U.S. military’s automation push is outpacing commercial efforts in the air, on land and underwater as officials seek to counter adversaries’ advances with technology that could later find civilian uses.
